title: Toshimasa Suzuki
text:
is a Japanese director, animator, and storyboard artist. He joined <a href="Shaft%20%28company%29">Shaft</a> in 1995 as an episode director and storyboard artist, and although he continues to work for Shaft, Suzuki commonly directs series with other studios, most notably with <a href="Xebec%20%28studio%29">Xebec</a>, where he made his series directorial debut with "<a href="Heroic%20Age%20%28TV%20series%29">Heroic Age</a>" in 2007.
Career and life.
Suzuki joined <a href="Shaft%20%28company%29">Shaft</a> around 1989 as a key animator. He made his debut as an episode director and storyboard artist for the studio's first original television series, "<a href="Juuni%20Senshi%20Bakuretsu%20Eto%20Ranger">Juuni Senshi Bakuretsu Eto Ranger</a>", in 1995. He continued to work solely for Shaft, doing outsourcing direction for various series until 2004, when he developed a relationship with <a href="Xebec%20%28studio%29">Xebec</a> as an episode director for "<a href="Fafner%20in%20the%20Azure">Fafner in the Azure</a>". In 2007, he debuted as a series director with Xebec with "<a href="Heroic%20Age%20%28TV%20series%29">Heroic Age</a>" under the supervision of Takashi Noto. For the next few years, Suzuki focused solely on freelancing work with other studios. He continued to do work with Xebec, directing "" and "<a href="Fafner%20in%20the%20Azure">Fafner in the Azure: Heaven and Earth</a>", and started directing series outside of either Xebec or Shaft, such as "<a href="The%20Pilot%27s%20Love%20Song">The Pilot's Love Song</a>" and "<a href="The%20Price%20of%20Smiles">The Price of Smiles</a>". However, he remains a prominent figure at Shaft and works on most of the studio's productions.
Suzuki was born in 1966, and he is married.
